The Science Center is working on a citizen science effort to monitor precipitation throughout Sitka, and 5 of our 10 stations are currently up! These rain gauges will be used to help with landslide prediction, and will also help calibrate the weather radar on Biorka Island, bringing more accurate forecasts to Sitka.
By going to www.bit.ly/sitkaData and scrolling down to zone AK023, you can see all data from the past 24 hours for all public weather monitors in Sitka. If you like, you can also download archived data by clicking on the station of interest, and clicking “Download Data” on the left-hand side.

~ Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
~ Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
~ Stay home when you are sick

CDC DOES recommend using alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol IF soap and water are not readily available.

~ Students need to be fever free for 24 hours before returning to school, so if a student has a fever, then no school the next day.

* WASH YOUR HANDS*

The CDC website also has updated and relevant information about the virus: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/summary.html.

Shelley Gillaspey RN
Sitka School District Nurse

Lisa Murkowski

Whether it’s traditional, charter, magnet, trade, language immersion, or others, offering a diverse range of educational options for young Alaskans is incredibly important. I had a great visit to Sitka's Pacific High School yesterday, led by Co-Assistant Superintendent Phil Burdick, Principal Mandy Summer, and teacher Matt Groen. Pacific High School is an alternative school for grades 9-12 that provides a unique learning experience with an emphasis on community and a culture of quality. Classes are multi-grade, teaching students students a wide range of skills and abilities (including cooking impressive meals through the Fish to School Program). During a ‘talking circle’ with the students, I heard story after story of the ways Pacific has impacted their lives—such as how they are supported and given a sense of belonging. To see what this school has to offer gets a gold star on my list.

May 19, 2019 at 12:52 PM ·

SHS Track & Field racked up the awards at the Region V Track and Field Championships this weekend. The awards are too numerous to list in one post, but a few highlights:

Joei Vidad won the 100m, 200m and 400m and broke the Region V record in the 400m.

Joei was also named the outstanding female athlete for Region V for the 2nd year in a row.

Garrison Lass set a new PR with a high jump of 6’2”

Boys 4x800m relay set a new Region V record

Sitka boys finished 1,2,3 in both the 400m and the triple jump

... many, many more!

Congrats to the SHS boys and girls track and field teams, 2019 Region V DII Champs!

Sitka High School
April 28, 2019 at 7:44 PM ·

What a great Weekend!!! We had around 200 kids outside playing, participating in Softball, Track and Field and Soccer. It was great to see them all between upper and lower Moller, enjoying the great weather, being very successful and most importantly having a great time!!! I would like to thank everyone for all their help, especially the city for preparing the track, the parents for all their support and volunteer work at the events, and the Sitka School District Staff for going above and beyond, during a very busy weekend!!!
Thank you. With sincere appreciation- Rich Krupa Activities Director, Sitka High School.
